channel.title: [PI] Added Castle Wars, Got Strange Errors
channel.description:
[code]src\server\model\players\Client.java:378: package c does not exist for (int i = 0; i < c.playerEquipment.length; i++) { ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:379: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c location: class server.model.players.Client if (c.playerEquipment[i] == itemID) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:83: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c location: class server.model.minigames.CastleWars } else if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] > 0 || c.playerEquipme nt[c.playerCape] > 0) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:83: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c location: class server.model.minigames.CastleWars } else if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] > 0 || c.playerEquipme nt[c.playerCape] > 0) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:83: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c location: class server.model.minigames.CastleWars } else if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] > 0 || c.playerEquipme nt[c.playerCape] > 0) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:83: cannot find symbol symbol : variable c location: class server.model.minigames.CastleWars } else if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerHat] > 0 || c.playerEquipme nt[c.playerCape] > 0) {
^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:174: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipment[Client.playerWeapon] = -1; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:175: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipmentN[Client.playerWeapon] = 0; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:188: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context if (player.playerEquipment[Client.playerWeapon] > 0) { ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:213: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipment[Client.playerWeapon] = flagId; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:214: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipmentN[Client.playerWeapon] = 1; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:215: non-static variable playerWeapon cannot be referenced from a static context player.getItems().updateSlot(Client.playerWeapon); ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:524: non-static variable playerCape c annot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipment[Client.playerCape] = capeId; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:525: non-static variable playerCape c annot be referenced from a static context player.playerEquipmentN[Client.playerCape] = 1; ^ src\server\model\minigames\CastleWars.java:526: non-static variable playerCape c annot be referenced from a static context player.getItems().updateSlot(Client.playerCape); ^ Note: src\server\world\map\C.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 15 errors Press any key to continue . . ./code][/code]

item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

I still can’t seem to get it to work.

might be player.getEquipment(). You are going to have to work with it a bit… Search your source for the playerHat variable, whatever class its in, look for a getter and setter for it. Then call that getter instead of using a static context

item.title: [PI] Added Castle Wars, Got Strange Errors
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

Most servers have some sort of player.getPlayer().playerhat.

You are referencing a non-static variable in a static context, using getters to access them
